intro: Thelycrania australis var. iberica, commonly known as the Iberian rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Spain and Portugal. It is a shrub characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of fragrant, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its botanical features include woody stems and a compact growth habit, making it well adapted to its Mediterranean climate. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
